alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 2:45PM EDT until September 08 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Northeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 244 PM EDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms were located over central Burlington County, or 21 miles west of Toms River, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Tabernacle, Shamong, Presidential Lakes Estates, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Presidential Lakes, Atsion, Cedar Glen Lakes, Whiting, Pine Ridge At Crestwood, Browns Mills, Leisuretowne, Holiday City-Berkeley, Country Lake Estates, Crestwood Village, Pemberton Heights, New Egypt, Fort Dix and McGuire AFB. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
